This replacement forend includes a built-in six-volt tactical light and two separate switches integrated into the forend: a pressure sensitive activation pad for momentary light use, and a constant On/Off rocker switch. The MALICE Pack, an acronym for Modified ALICE, is Tactical Tailor's improved version of the military issue large ALICE Pack. Our pack takes the proven design of the decades old ALICE Pack and brings into the 21st century and beyond. We started by constructing the entire pack out of 1000 denier Cordura Nylon and reinforcing the high stress areas of the pack. Accessing the pack has been made easier and faster by replacing the snaps on the three main outside pockets with quick release Fastex buckles and adding the same buckles to the main straps. The hook and loop opening on the top flap has been replaced with a zipper and an 8" x 12" x 4" Claymore pocket has been added to the top of the flap. The pack also features a storm flap, carry handle and drain holes in all pockets. Fully compatible with issue ALICE pack frame, straps and belt.
MALICE Pack Version 3:
The MALICE Pack Version 3 is the same as the Version 2 but the zippered pocket on the left side of the pack is replaced by a 7" x 18" x 4" hydration pocket and a non-removable sleeping bag compartment has been added to the bottom of the pack with three cinch straps.
Main Compartment Capacity: 3276 cu. in.
Total Capacity: 6474 cu. in.

http://www.tacticaltailor.com/malicepackversion3kit.aspx

title: For Sale:  -SOLD- AR Pistol, DUAL uppers, 5.56 & 300AAC Blackout
location: South of Farmville, Greenville, North Carolina
postcontent:
This is my baby, but I need cash for another project, so I need to let it go.
It's technically not a pistol or rifle, according to the ATF definition. They call it a "firearm". Very helpful, right? :)

This is almost like getting 2 rifles, since you can swap calibers in well under a minute.
Shoot 5.56 at the range, then switch to 300AAC to take down a deer that evening.
Also, the short overall length (only 27.5" with 300AAC upper, around 31" with 5.56 upper) makes it easy to handle and maneuver in a vehicle or inside a building. 

Anyway, here are the specifics of the build...

Lower Half:
- New Frontier All-Polymer lower with lifetime warranty (very smooth trigger!)
- Extended takedown and pivot pins (steel) by Xtreme Precision
- Sig Sauer SigTac SB-15 pistol brace, intending for firing with one hand while strapped to the user's arm.
- Extended buffer tube assembly, with single point sling plate
- Forged charging handle with extended tac latch
- Magpul MOE pistol grip

223/5.56 upper:
- Mil-Spec forged upper (Cerro Forge), with forward assist assembly
- 11.5" Heavy Contour barrel, 1:9 twist, chrome-lined
- Seekins Precision Melonited gas tube, carbine length
- LJC adjustable low profile gas block (US made)
- 12" free floating carbon fiber modular handguard, with custom 3D printed end cap and (re)movable rails
- Magpul RVG vertical grip (semi-permanent installation, for ATF compliance. Having an OAL of greater than 26", this is not a short barreled rifle by ATF definition.)
- Custom-machined (by me) 'flash can' style muzzle device, to direct blast forward. 
	Reduces concussive force felt by shooter.

300 AAC Blackout upper:
- 8.5" barrel, Melonite coated, 1:8 twist, HPT/MPI
- Muzzle threaded 5/8x24, A2-type flash hider
- Low Profile Micro Gas Block
- Pistol length gas system with stainless gas tube
- Carbine length free floated quad rail (T-marked) with vented end cap
- Forged Upper Receiver (Anchor Harvey) with forward assist assembly

Other/shared components:
- Full-auto type bolt carrier, with Barnes Precision bolt
- (2) brand new Tapco 30-round poly mags, one with a "300AAC" sticker, so you don't try to load the wrong caliber in the wrong upper!

All components are brand new, other than minimal rounds fired for testing and tuning purposes.

*T-1 micro-type red dot sight shown in photos is NOT included, but is available. Inquire if interested.

Not really looking for trades, but feel free to offer if you have something really interesting.

title: For Sale:  SMITH & WESSON 586-1 Nickel 357 6" Revolver. Excellent cond. w/holster.
postcontent:
Called the "Distinguised Combat Magnum," the 586 is S&W's most decorated 357.  It is an L framed 6-shot revolver with the full lug.  This is a rare 6" Nickel model.  Gun is beautiful as the pictures show.  Fired very little and had been a safe queen for quite some time.  Barely noticable turn-line and it looks as good or better in person as it does in the pictures. I'm including two other sets of grips: hogue monogrip rubber and some jordan pachmayer's that are cracked and can be thrown away or used for whatever.

I forgot, also has a very nice Galco leather holster with the soft suede lining so as not to scratch nickel or blued guns.

Perfect lockup, trigger action and timing.  This model was made in 1987 according to the serial numbers.  SandW ceased production of nickel 586's in 1991.

$785.  I encourage people to try and find one of these on the net in 6" nickel, cause I had a hell of a time.

Text/call (515) six64-5978 with questions or for more detailed pics of the cylinder, chamber, etc, as I have plenty.

Thanks.

The mark on the pic of the right side close to the grip is just a glare/shadow. Not a flaw.

This is a 66 so it was among the last versions of the gun produced with a pinned barrel and recessed cylinders, as such it features the most up-to-date build quality without sacrificing the desirable features from older S&Ws. The trigger is extremely smooth, fantastic double action and a very light, crisp single action, you honestly couldn't ask for any better.

title: For Sale:  ** BEWARE ** BEWARE **
location: Fair Play, SC, Greenville, South Carolina
postcontent:
Beware of a person in Taylors, E.A. Bates (Elgin). He will make a deal with you, agree to meet you while continuing to make deals with others on the same gun.

In my case he was offering a gun with some ammo and extras. We agreed on a price and arranged to meet. So last Saturday I traveled 50 miles one way to meet him in Greenville. About ten minutes after the agreed upon time I got a call from him stating that he couldn’t meet with me due to a family situation. He said he could meet with me again this past Wednesday at 6PM. I have contacted him via phone/text/email since Tuesday evening with no response.

So if you inquire about a gun from a person in Taylors and the response email is from an E. A. Bates BEWARE!

Fred
Fair Play, SC

title: For Sale:  7.62 bolt action, HIGHLY customized
location: South of Farmville, Greenville, North Carolina
postcontent:
I'm not really sure where to start describing this one.
It's based on a Tula Mosin Nagant action, but there's very little of the original gun that wasn't replaced, upgraded, or reworked. Check the photos for a better idea.
I built this to look rustic or distressed, but it's very solid, no junk.

It shoots 7.52x54r ammo, and I'm including around 100 rounds of 147gr steel core Silver Tip. They can't really call this 'armor piercing', due to import and ownership restrictions, but let's just say it was made to punch though steel helmets, so other lighter armor isn't gonna help much.

The barrel was reprofiled, shortened to 20.25", and threaded 14mm LH, the same as an AK.
The muzzle brake is VERY effective at reducing recoil, and makes a heck of a blast when you fire it. It also has those wicked sharp points for use as a close-in 'deterrent'. :)

All the metal has been Duracoated in OD Green and Desert Brown, with matte black on the scope mount to reduce glare.

The thumbhole stock was hand carved, epoxy-bedded for accuracy and solid mounting, then coated in a rubberized sealant that kinda feels similar to truck bed lining, but thinner and less 'tacky' to the touch. It has a grit texture embedded in the coating to increase grip, especially if your hands are wet.
Over top of that, is a light coat of a softer, more velvety coating, that was then partially removed to give the weathered look.
You can pretty easily remove the top coat if you prefer.
The recoil pad is thicker than most, has custom cut and profiled with a solid aluminum backing plate. It really cuts down the felt recoil.
Between the pad and the muzzle break, I'd say this gun recoils about double that of a 5.56 AR, which isn't much!

The scope mount is custom machined from a solid billet of aluminum, and is mounted in a scout configuration.

I have a cheap red dot type sight on there now, since I was setting this up for close range work, under 75 yards. You could easily get a long eye relief (LER) or 'scout' scope, if you prefer a magnified optic.

All the internal bolts components and bearing surfaces have been polished and Duracoated. They will wear through to bare metal only where actual contact occurs. This offers the best corrosion protection, while making it look and function the best it can.
The bolt handle was forged from a single piece of steel into a "spoon"-type profile, threaded, then epoxied into the bolt body. This flat profile makes it easier to open and close the action, especially while keeping the sight picture.

There aren't many truly unique guns available these days, so here's your chance to own a real one of a kind. Since I did the work myself, and fabricated several of the parts, I can say with confidence that there is not another one like this on the planet.

More photos available for serious buyers, not looking for trades.
Got another project in mind and need cash to make it happen.

postcontent:
YOU CAN BUY THIS HERE>LWRC M6IC Enhanced 5.56mm OD Green 

The IC Enhanced rifle uses our Cold Hammer Forged barrels that are spiral fluted to reduce weight. They include a two position gas block, with a bayonet lug, that can be switched between suppressed and non-suppressed modes. This feature enables the user to restrict the gas flow to the piston system, allowing the rifle to run smoothly and compensate for the added back pressure resulting from running a suppressor. We complete the upper with our modular rail in a nine inch length. This handguard utilizes individual rail sections that allow the owner to place accessory rails where they are needed while retaining the slick, low profile nature of the rest of the handguard.

The IC-Enhanced is perfect for those who wish to have a fluted barrel along with an adjustable gas block, allowing you to shoot suppressed.
The IC-Enhanced is essentially identical to the IC-SPR mechanically; with a shorter rail and adjustable gas block.

The IC-SPR may be a better option if you prefer a longer rail and have no use for an adjustable gas block.

Barrel Length: 14.7", 16.1" Spiral Fluted
Weight (unloaded): 7.1lbs (16.1" barrel)

Only 90% the size of a P226, the Mosquito, chambered in 22LR, is the ideal choice for hours of shooting fun. Its wear-resistant polymer frame and integral accessory rail is ergonomically designed to enhance accuracy and provide a better all-around shooting experience. Additional features include a rugged blowback system, fixed barrel and adjustable rear sight. title: For Sale:  Bushmaster 90216 XM-15 AR-15 Carbine A2 Patrolman''s SA 223/5.56 16" 30+1 Bl
postcontent: Overview Like Model Like Series Manufacturer Information: The M4-Type Patrolman's Carbine is one of Bushmaster's most popular carbines, and it's great for 3-gun match shooting, home defense, and law enforcement use. It features a six-position telestock and a 16" barrel with a threaded A2 birdcage flash suppressor (for a total length of 17.25"). The bore and chamber of the barrel are chrome-lined for ease of cleaning and longevity, and the carbine has a Mil-Spec manganese phosphate outer coating that protects the barrel and critical steel components from corrosion and rust. The upper receiver is offered in A2 and A3 configurations. The A2 upper receiver (SSI 13231) has a 300-800 meter rear sight system with 1 MOA elevation and 1/2 MOA windage adjustments. The A3 upper receiver (SSI 13230, 84824) features a Picatinny rail, a removable carry handle, and a 300-600 meter rear sight system with 1/2 MOA elevation and windage adjustments. The carbine ships with a magazine, an operator safety manual, a chamber flag, and a sling. Product Specifications: Metal Finish: Black Action: Semi-Automatic Caliber: 223 Remington/5.56 NATO Barrel Length: 16.0" Capacity: 30+1 Trigger: Single Stage Safety: Lever OAL: 32.5"-34.75" Weight: 6.35 lbs Stock Description: 6-Position Collapsible Black Muzzle: A2 Flash Hider Receiver Material: Aluminum Sights: A2 Front, Battle Rear Barrel Description: Chrome Moly Steel Chrome-Lined Twist: 1:9" Stock Finish Group: Synthetic Metal Finish Group: Blued/Black Not legal in all States. title: For Sale:  Sig Sauer P238 .380ACP (NEW)
postcontent:
Reacting to many requests from the marketplace for a subcompact SIG SAUER pistol, engineers designed the new P238 as a smart looking, small handgun built with the same accuracy and reliability as large frame SIG SAUER pistols. With an overall length of just 5.5 inches a height of 3.96 inches, and weighing just under a pound, the SIG SAUER P238 is the ultimate firepower in an all metal frame concealed pistol. The P238 is built on an anodized alloy beavertail style frame with fluted grips for comfort and a secure hold during rapid-fire usage. The stainless steel slide features the popular SIG SAUER slide serrations and improves overall performance and accuracy. Additionally, the SIGLITE® Night Sights are removable and adjustable for windage. The sear and trigger return spring are redesigned to prevent spring over-ride of the ejector during assembly. The new SIG SAUER P238 is shipped in a lockable hard case with one 6 round magazine.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Ar-15 Bushmaster Varminter 24", complete or upper only.
postcontent:
Bushmaster Varminter 24" upper complete with the factory matched bolt and carrier group, charging handle and original Bushmaster hard case.  Squeaky clean upper !!

Upper only purchase will include all upper components only nothing else and of course a negotiated FS/FT price.

Has been kept in a temperature and humidity controlled gun safe it's whole life, I have all receipts and documentation.  I bought this to go varmint hunting and never went!!

I am a gun aficionado and shot the barrel in properly as factory recommended.  I still shoot no more than ten rounds without a good bore cleaning from the breach only.

I do not shoot this regularly it stays in the safe.  I have a dedicated 16" upper I use when I go out to shoot for fun, I use the 24" Varminter upper for long range practice only.

I don't think there's a mark on it, if your interested look up what you think is the going value and maybe we can do a deal.  Remember this is a complete upper just slap on your optics and pull the trigger.

Also, this is a tack driver-factory matched and validated piece of workmanship.  I think this is a generous offer for someone wanting a "sniper accurate" or "varmint accurate" upper.

Diamondback Firearms is proud to present the DB9, a micro-compact 9mm pistol made entirely in the USA. Designed with safety in mind, the DB9 features a "ZERO-Energy" striker firing system with a mechanical firing pin block, a steel magazine catch to secure a sheet metal magazine and real windage-adjustable sights, all in a lightweight pistol.
